Table.name: Collateral
Table.commentInRDBMS: Collateral is an asset that is pledged to mitigate the credit risk that may arise from a contract that is not an Instrument.

Column.name: Collateral_Reference_date
Column.comment: The date the data refers to.

Column.name: Collateral_Reporting_agent_identifier
Column.comment: Identifier of the reporting agent.

Column.name: Collateral_identifier
Column.comment: An identifier to uniquely identify each collateral.

Column.name: Collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between financial and physical collateral.

Column.name: Obtained_collateral_type
Column.comment: Obtained collateral type distinguishes Collateral whether it is a collateral obtained by taking possession and other collaterals that are not obtained.

Column.name: Original_protection_value
Column.comment: The protection’s fair value at the date when it was originally received as a credit protection.

Column.name: Date_of_original_protection_value
Column.comment: The date of the protection’s original value, i.e. the date on which the latest appraisal or valuation of the protection was carried out prior to its initial receipt as a credit protection.

Column.name: Protection_value_date
Column.comment: Protection value date is the date on which the latest appraisal or valuation of the protection was carried out prior to the reporting reference date.

Column.name: Physical_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of physical collateral.

Column.name: Registered_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of registered collateral, like real estate collateral or ship collateral.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_fair_value4
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Aircraft collateral

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Mark-to-market: Valuation method whereby the protection value is based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in an active market.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral6
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Real_estate_collateral_location_type
Column.comment: Real estate collateral location type is a discriminator to distinguish between real estate collateral located in a member state or not in a member state.

Column.name: Real_estate_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of real estate collateral.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach1
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Real estate

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Under_construction_or_developement_indicator
Column.comment:
Under construction or development indicator indicates whether the property is under construction or development.
Finrep Annex V. Part 2.350, 352(a). With regard to collateral in the form of immovable property (a) immovable property that is under construction or development.

Column.name: Long-term_sustainable_value_amount_of_the_collateral
Column.comment: Long-term sustainable value amount of the collateral is the ‘mortgage lending value’ of immovable property as defined in Article 4(1)(74) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013. To be used if the protection is immovable property when the 'mortgage lending value' is reported in the data attribute 'Protection value'.

Column.name: Market_value_amount_of_the_collateral
Column.comment: The market value of collateral.

Column.name: Non-reporting_member_state_Country_code
Column.comment: The country code of the non-reporting member state.

Column.name: Country_code
Column.comment: The country code according to ISO3166.

Column.name: Nomenclature_des_unités_territoriales_statistiques_(NUTS)_region
Column.comment: The region inside a country according to NUTS.

Column.name: Postal_code
Column.comment: Entity's postal code.

Column.name: Commercial_real_estate_and_offices_and_commercial_premises_collateral_type
Column.comment: Commercial real estate and offices and commercial premises collateral type distinguishes Commercial real estate and offices and commercial premises collateral according to their type.

Column.name: Offices_and_commercial_premises_collateral_indicator
Column.comment: Offices and commercial premises collateral indicator distinguishes Offices and commercial premises collateral based on whether it is land or non-land related.

Column.name: Agriculture_land_indicator
Column.comment: Agriculture land indicator distinguishes Commercial real estate collateral related to land basd on whether the land includes agriculture or not.

Column.name: Planning_permission_for_development_indicator
Column.comment: Planning permission for development indicator distinguishes Land excluding agriculture based on whether planning permission for development applies or not.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_fair_value3
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Ship collateral

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Mark-to-market: Valuation method whereby the protection value is based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in an active market.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral5
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Non-registered_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between different types of non-registered collateral. Examples are machinery and equipment collateral, commodity collateral.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_fair_value2
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Non-registered collateral

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Mark-to-market: Valuation method whereby the protection value is based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in an active market.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral4
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Commodity_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between gold and other commodity collateral.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_notional_amount2
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.

valueDef.description: Other type of valuation: Other type of valuation not included in any other valuation categories.

Column.name: Notional_amount_of_the_collateral2
Column.comment: The notional amount on a financial instrument is the nominal or face amount that is used to calculate payments made on that instrument.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_notional_amount1
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Other non-registered collateral

valueDef.description: Other type of valuation: Other type of valuation not included in any other valuation categories.

Column.name: Notional_amount_of_the_collateral1
Column.comment: The notional amount on a financial instrument is the nominal or face amount that is used to calculate payments made on that instrument.

Column.name: Protection_arrangement_Reference_date
Column.comment: The date the data refers to.

Column.name: Protection_arrangement_Reporting_agent_identifier
Column.comment: Identifier of the reporting agent.

Column.name: Protection_arrangement_identifier
Column.comment: The protection arrangement of the collateral annex.

Column.name: Financial_collateral_type
Column.comment: A discriminator to distinguish between security collateral, currency collateral and other financial collateral.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_notional_amount
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of valuation approach for Fianncial collateral

valueDef.description: Other type of valuation: Other type of valuation not included in any other valuation categories.

Column.name: Notional_amount_of_the_collateral
Column.comment: The notional amount on a financial instrument is the nominal or face amount that is used to calculate payments made on that instrument.

Column.name: Security_identifier
Column.comment: An identifier to uniquely identify each security.

Column.name: Security_Reference_date
Column.comment: The date the data refers to.

Column.name: Security_Reporting_agent_identifier
Column.comment: Identifier of the reporting agent.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_fair_value1
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Security collateral

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Mark-to-market: Valuation method whereby the protection value is based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in an active market.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral3
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Currency
Column.comment: The currency code according to ISO4217.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach_for_fair_value
Column.comment: Type of protection valuation approach.
Column.constraintName: Type of protection valuation approach for Other financial collateral

valueDef.description: Counterparty estimation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the provider of the protection.

Creditor valuation: Valuation method whereby the valuation is carried out by the creditor: valuation undertaken by an external or staff appraiser who possesses the necessary qualifications, ability and experience to execute a valuation and who is not independent from the credit decision process.
Mark-to-market: Valuation method whereby the protection value is based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in an active market.
Third-party valuation: Valuation method in which the valuation is provided by an appraiser who is independent from the credit decision process.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral2
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Security_Reference_date2
Column.comment: The date the data refers to.

Column.name: Security_Reporting_agent_identifier2
Column.comment: Identifier of the reporting agent.

Column.name: Security_identifier2
Column.comment: An identifier to uniquely identify each security.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral1
Column.comment: Fair value of the Exchange tradable derivative collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9.

Column.name: Immaterial_rights_collateral_type
Column.comment: Immaterial rights collateral type distinguishes Immaterial rights as collateral according to its nature.

Column.name: Type_of_protection_valuation_approach
Column.comment: Protection valuation approach is the type of protection valuation approach used to valuate Immateral rights as collateral.

Column.name: Fair_value_amount_of_the_collateral
Column.comment: Fair value of the collateral as defined in IFRS 13.9. for the Immaterial rights as collateral.

Column.name: Balance_sheet_recognition_date
Column.comment: Balance sheet recognition date is a date on which the Collateral obtained by taking possession was taken into possession and thus recognised on the balance sheet.

Column.name: Carrying_amount
Column.comment: The carrying amount of the collateral obtained by taking possession in accordance with Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

Column.name: Derecognised_exposure_gross_carrying_amount
Column.comment: Derecognised exposure gross carrying amount is an amount, that is the gross carrying amount of exposures that are derecognised on the balance sheet in exchange for Collateral obtained by taking possession.

Column.name: Derecognised_exposure_accumulated_impairment
Column.comment:
Accumulated impairment is the amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the derecognised exposure on the reporting reference date for which the Collateral obtained by taking possession has been obtained.
This data attribute applies to assets subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following amounts: (i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances; (ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.

Column.name: Accumulated_fair_value_changes_of_the_exposure_due_to_credit_risk
Column.comment:
Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014 of the exposure that is derecognised because of the Collateral obtained by taking possession.
Note: This amount must only be reported when it is negative.

Column.name: Initial_recognition_value
Column.comment:
Initial recognition value is an amount, expressed in EUR, that is the value of the Collateral obtained by taking possession at the moment of recognising it in the balance sheet.
FINREP Annex V: Value at initial recognition shall mean the gross carrying amount of the collateral obtained by taking possession at the point in time of the initial recognition in the balance sheet of the reporting institution.
